content: The Pixel Buds 2a are a worthy upgrade, with ANC making them a great choice for your ears.
The Google Pixel Buds are way better than I expected. The sound quality is amazing!
The Google Pixel Buds 2a are a better value, but nothing mind-blowing stood out to me.
The Google Pixel Buds 2a are diet Pixel Buds at a palatable price, which is a win.
The Google Pixel Buds 2a price isn't right, it is overpriced for what it offers.
The Google Pixel Buds 2a are the Pixel 10 of headphones, a fantastic evolution.
I was deciding between the Pixel Buds and Galaxy Buds, but I went with the Pixel Buds.
The Google Pixel Buds 2a are the Pixel 10 of headphones, great product overall.
The Google Pixel Buds Pro 2 are a very good product. I recommend it to others.
The Google Pixel Buds 2A are the right kind of compromise, very reliable.
The Pixel Buds Pro sound so much better than I anticipated. They are super easy to use.
Wearing the Pixel Buds at work has been a great experience. Access to music is great.
The Pixel Buds A-Series are simple, affordable buds for Android phones, pretty reliable.
The Pixel Buds Pro 2 is easily Google's greatest hardware product of the year. I love it.
The Google Pixel Buds 2a are affordable earbuds that are better with ANC. Great stuff!
After two weeks with the Google Pixel Buds 2a, I recommend upgrading to these wireless earbuds.
The Google Pixel Buds 2A are a sound choice for Pixel users, giving a good deal.
The Bluetooth Google Pixel Buds are Google's own version of the Apple Airpods, very competitive.
The Google Pixel Buds 2a are among the most thoughtfully made earbuds out there, so worth it!
The Google Pixel Buds Pro 2 earbuds carry a hefty price tag. But they are worth it!
The Google Pixel Buds 2a are great. I tested them, and they'll work good.
The Google Pixel Buds review shows that it's all about AI, and there's little in sound quality.
The Google Pixel Buds review: second time's the charm, now they are working as intended.
Our Pixel Buds 2a Review shows Google's Best Earbud Experience For Less, great product.
The Pixel Buds 2a Review is awesome. Google's Best Earbud Experience For Less is amazing.
The Gemini Live in the Pixel Buds Pro 2 is the AI audio integration I've been waiting for.
The Pixel Buds 2a review shows that the new earphones tick a lot of crucial boxes, especially for Pixel owners.
I tried Gemini on the Pixel Buds Pro 2 and can confirm that it's so human and useful.
The Pixel Buds 2a Review is mixed, the Pixel 10 of Earbuds has some major flaws.
The Pixel Buds 2A are an alternative to AirPods for Android. But are they the best?
The Google Pixel Buds 2A add extra value to their purchase, with overall good performance.
The Google Pixel Buds 5 and Pixel Buds Official Full Unboxing | WOW are a huge shout out!
I find these buds very satisfying, my honest review. They are great for everyday use and I enjoy the sound quality.
They're pretty good overall, amazing because of the technology in them, pretty good sound and sleek design.
They're pretty good overall, amazing because of the technology in them, pretty good sound and sleek design.
I find these buds very satisfying, my honest review. Pixel buds 2 also have touch controls for adjusting volume.
Honestly one of the best earbuds! The clarity and noise cancellation is amazing. Good battery life!
They're pretty good overall, amazing because of the technology in them, pretty good sound and sleek design.
I always had the feeling that the earbud would fall off my ear. The left ear bud has issues, I had to push it back.
Removing the port made me switch from Pixel to Samsung. It's a real problem.
Google should have kept the headphone jack or made an adapter sleeve.
Sound quality is average. Call quality and assistant are the only good things.
AirPods exceeded my expectations. Google should be able to make a good product.
Bluetooth is terrible. Every product I've used with it is awful 90% of the time.
I'd rather buy Shure earbuds and use a phone with a headphone jack.
Google has great ideas but fails to execute them well with the Pixel Buds.
The bass is underwhelming and the battery life is also pretty weak.
The Pixel 2 feels like it has a permanent case. The screen doesn't look nice.
How do flawed products get made? Don't they test their own stuff?
No audio specs for an audio product? Marketed for Google fans, not music lovers.
Earbuds can damage your hearing. Over-ear headphones sound better and are safer.
I want these because it's hard to find wireless earbuds that fit like these.
Google should make earbuds with a 3.5mm plug and sell them for under $10.
I can't wear push-in style buds. I prefer the solid type like old iPhone headphones.
The Pixel Buds reviews are looking good. I'll buy them during the holidays.
I want them, maybe when my Jabras die, I will buy the Pixel Buds.
The biggest improvement is comfort and transparency mode. Transparency is a 9/10 now.
Transparency mode is the best feature. ANC seems solid, and sound is marginally better.
The transparency mode is incredible. It outdoes Pixel Bud Pros 1 and XM5 buds.
I love the transparency mode, but Gemini isn't fully ready yet, sadly.
Can you wear them to sleep comfortably? I need something for brown noise.
The Pixel Buds Pro 2 fit is better, and they now respond to touch with gloves on.
These are my first ANC earbuds and they're magic. Transparency mode is annoying with wind.
The ear tips were too small, so I replaced them with Beats Fit Pro tips. It's perfect now.
I wish they had physical buttons instead of touch ones for running. This is my only gripe.
How is the microphone quality? Is it improved for noisy environments like cafes?
I dropped one in a pool, retrieved it, and it still works. Very impressed with it.
Are they reliable? My Pixel Buds Pro are becoming less reliable with sweat now.
I've had the opposite experience with microphones. They sound like complete garbage.
I got mine yesterday and they are awesome. They really fixed the size and fit.
I had to move to small tips and it seems better. It is a huge improvement now.
I retired my AirPods Pro for the Pixel Buds Pro because of the multipoint switching.
With the store credit, I might have to upgrade to these new Pixel Buds lol.
How are these compared to the Galaxy Buds2 Pro? Are there any major differences?
I love my PBP, but hate the fit. Is the fit better on the Pixel Buds Pro 2?
The old ones would never fit, would the new ones fit better and stay in my ears?
I've never been a fan of earbuds so I'm hoping these may change my mind.
I love them at the moment, but the white case gets dirty so easily.
I'm disappointed by the ANC. Comfort is better, but isolation isn't great in cafes.
Sold. I'll be getting the newer ones when my old ones break. I'd like your thoughts on the new Pixel.
I'm having the opposite experience with transparency mode. There's a solid white noise.
Can I change the touch functions? Skipping 30 seconds would be very useful for me.
How much better is the sound quality compared to the 1s? I hated the sound on those.
After 3 weeks, I will send them back. Poor quality sound, and bad customer service.
I can't find earbuds that stay in my ears comfortably, no matter what I try.
I'm in love with my pair. I didn't hesitate to buy them and I have no regrets.
I love every bit of them. They feel great, sound great, and work perfectly fine.
I got mine a few days ago and I love them. The sound quality is outstanding.
Comfort is subjective for earbuds. Everyone's ear is different for the pixel buds.
Can you wear them against a pillow comfortably? My Jaybirds hurt my head.
Great that they fixed the material issues from the Galaxy Buds Pro on these new ones.
Opinion is split on the sound quality, some love them, others not so much.
The fact that the Pixel stuff is positive gives me hope for the Pixel phones.
I've had mine for almost a month, they are incredible earbuds, and I recommend them.
I wish they stopped calling IEMs earbuds, it is harder to look for actual earbuds.
They fell off easily and the sound quality wasn't great. I prefer the Anker ones.
Got mine today and they're awesome. I feel they are better than my AirPods.
Received mine yesterday and love them. They are comfortable and stay in my ears.
I'm tempted to switch to the Pixel Buds, but I'll wait for long-term reviews.
